content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very high quality puzzle. Beautiful tests and validators üîù

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: the puzzle can be solved quick and I think that people will like it.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a fun quick puzzle, not 'trivial' enough for the CoC.
Lots of nice tests/validators like always with Lisa :D

Goal
* Please add full-stops.

* Please mention how coordinates increase along the X-axis and the Y-axis.

* Please explain what "carve out" means (replacing each {{*}} in the triangle (its edges and its inside) with a space character).

* Please move the explanation of {{expanded}} [[style]] from Input section to here. Also, suggest to change "a row" to "every row".

* Please add an explanation of {{condensed}} [[style]] (no space is added between {{*}}).

Input
* Line 1: Please add "space-separated".

* Suggest to change the last description as follows:
<<Next [[howManyTriangles]] Lines>>: 6 space-separated integers representing a single triangle, [[X1]] [[Y1]] [[X2]] [[Y2]] [[X3]] [[Y3]]. Each pair of [[X]] and [[Y]] represents the X and Y-coordinates of one vertex of the triangle.

Output
* Please change "Line" to "Lines".

* Suggest to delete the last sentence.

Constraints
* Please add the lower and upper limits of HI, WI, howManyTriangles, X1, Y1, X2, Y2, X3 and Y3.

Cases
* I haven't checked in detail, but it seems that Validator 9 is the only case where some of the Y-coordinates of a triangle's vertexes are outside the grid. If that is the case, please revise the cases so that there's a test with such a situation too.

By the way, in your solution code, you have imported "random" but it's not used‚Ä¶?

Thanks.

This is my first Python* submission.  Very exciting.
*FYI, learned here and highly recommended: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5Jppcxc1Qzc

Fantastic as always 5DN1L

I‚Äôll work thru these in the next 1-2 days
I believe I have fixed all now.  :)

Let's fix it a bit more üòâ

Input
* Missing "<" in the bold formatting of the last line number description.

Constraints/Cases
* In Validator 9, there's an x-coordinate of -12, which is inconsistent with the constraints.

* In Test 10, there's a y-coordinate of -10, which is inconsistent with the constraints.

* In Validator 10, there's a y-coordinate of -10, and the height is 7, both of which are inconsistent with the constraints.

Cases
* Validators 9 and 10 are the only cases where some of the Y-coordinates of a triangle's vertexes are greater than or equal to grid height. Please include some corresponding tests to cover such a situation.

Thanks! üôÇ
Right, right.  Excellent as always.  I‚Äôll work thru these in the next 1-2 days
